programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Howie Mandel wants ATM to build another tank! This time its a surprise for his managers company - and their an existing tank needs a major upgrade.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emotional case lies in store for Houston SPCAs animal cruelty investigators when they find a puppy that has been badly beaten and has 13 broken bones.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators find a young puppy suffering without water or shelter. Meanwhile, a tourist attraction has an unwanted visitor - a wild alligator.

programme.title: Shark Week Immersion
programme.desc: Internet stars take on Shark Week, testing some of the top shark-related concepts in pop culture.

programme.title: Monsters Inside Me
programme.desc: A man breaks out in a mysterious painful rash. A woman suffers bouts of piercing pain in her throat, and a teen is hit by unexplained dizziness and fatigue.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson visits a house divided, with four cats always fighting. Plus, hes at a cattery where territorial issues forced two cats to live in isolation for years.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Chandler must handle a koala crisis, while Terri lends a hand to care for an influx of puggles. Plus, a turtle called Billy undergoes a critical surgery.

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: The bird department work feverishly to restore a beehive for the bee-eater birds. And Ambassador Center staff work with an adorable Fennex fox named Charlie.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to Alaska to investigate the disappearance of the king salmon. His search will take him through grizzly bear territory, remote native communities and the Pacific Ocean as he follows a trail of evidence.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A client brings in an unusual pet who is fast outgrowing his enclosure. And, Dr. Jeff treats a pet cat with multiple serious and mysterious injuries.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Pianoworks in New York wants Wayde and Brett to build them their own piano-shaped tank made from acrylic. Will the guys hit the right note?

programme.title: Vet Life: Bonus Tails
programme.desc: Dr. Lavigne finds a surprise on one of his favourite patients X-ray. And, Dr. Blue has his hands full with a former fraternity house pig called Aubie.

programme.title: Vet Life: Bonus Tails
programme.desc: Dr. Lavigne performs a risky surgery on a loving pit bull with a record-breaking tumour. Plus, the vets deal with a heart-breaking situation at the clinic.

programme.title: Louisiana Law
programme.desc: Agents track down a boat captain breaking the law in Plaquemines Parish. Plus, a family of shrimpers are investigated for pulling oversized nets.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Oyster season keeps the wardens busy on the land and on water. Hunters are investigated for trespassing and a deck hand with several warrants is questioned.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete builds a treehouse for the Mt McKinley Princess Wilderness Lodge. The team constructs an A-frame masterpiece with stunning Alaskan mountain views.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Audley End, Essex, where experts value a sword that played an important role in the end of the American War of Independence, a collection of toilet chains and a silver container that once contained a goats gallstone believed to have magical powers. The biggest shock of the day comes when Eric Knowles reveals the worth of a set of three vases decorated with fairies.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The celebratory launch of a new luxury resort is cut short when a woman is found electrocuted in her hotel bathtub - with the door locked from the inside. It looks like a simple case of suicide, but with Jack Mooney no longer around to confirm Commissioner Selwyns suspicions, DI Neville Parker is temporarily flown over from Manchester to close the case. However, he soon realises that island life is not for him, so when evidence of suspicious activity turns up, he is dismayed to realise he will have to extend his stay and investigate the case as murder.

programme.title: Rick Steins Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef embarks on another round of extended culinary breaks, visiting markets, restaurants, wineries, cafes and bars, beginning with Portuguese capital Lisbon. The culinary effects of Portugals historic explorations are still seen in its dishes with hints of cinnamon and freshly chopped coriander from the east and tomatoes and chillies from the Americas. Rick is inspired to cook salt cod fritters and an almond tart, before heading for the St Anthonys Day Parade and Sardine Festival.

programme.desc: Bean arranges a last-minute birthday treat for Teddy, including a morning in a toy shop and burgers for lunch. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to watch the motor racing on TV, when Mrs Wicket interrupts him to offer a deal – revamp her garden with new paving and ornaments, and he’ll get a month’s rent for free. Bean reluctantly agrees, but when he sees Mr Paliwal finish a personal training session and keen for more, he offers him a new workout… doing all Mr Bean’s work for him while he watches the racing! Win, win!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In a trampoline park, Bean competes in a race with a boy. The winner gets Teddy. Will Bean and Teddy be separated forever?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma is struggling to sell items from her knitwear stall at the market, so sends Mr Bean to collect a sheep costume he can wear to attract customers. Once at the fancy dress shop however, Mr Bean gets stuck in the sheep costume and has to travel back to the market wearing it. Things go from bad to worse when Mr Bean takes a short cut across the field and gets caught up in a flock of real sheep!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: A lab accident causes Lamput to grow giant in size! The Docs must find a way to deal with this gargantuan problem and catch him roaming the big city!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Safety standards at the Docs Lab remain shockingly low. Once, just once, it would be nice to invent something that doesnt then get out of hand and backfire, causing widespread chaos. Well, this shrink ray aint it. At first it works great (which is typical). Lamput is caught in a tiny vial, and the Docs are riding high on the triumph. Then they go over a small bump. Their risk management plan doesnt account for a "small bump". Before long Lamput and Skinny are engaged in a high speed chase through the Boss moustache. Seriously. Someone should just shrink this Lab right out of existence. No, wait, that happens too.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput escapes the Lab and the unenviable task of orange-blob-retrieval falls to Specs and Skinny. The Boss equips them with increasingly expensive vehicles. The real issue might be staffing.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: With a lion-tamers whip a sugar bowl and lots of work the Lemmings have successfully trained a caribou to go through their obstacle course.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings think that programming a new electronic lemming toy to dance would be a lot more fun than having it just feed Grizzy snacks.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds himself unwillingly caught up in a race between two teams of Lemmings. When he understands the stakes, he tries to win but loses. Grizzy has his pride: he wants a re-match.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have placed giant remote-controlled hydraulic jacks under the cabin to transform it into a life-sized rolling ball game. Grizzy, who in inclined to seasickness, tries to put things back in place. The cabin tips over into empty space.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is disturbed during his nap by a few uncatchable flies which buzz incessantly around his head. When he realizes that the carnivorous plant upon which the Lemmings are playing rodeo feeds off flying insects, he decides to confiscate it and use it as an anti-fly weapon.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom accidentally loses Tyke, he must distract Spike from looking for him. Jerry must try to find Tyke from a litter of identical looking puppies.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: On the edge of the village of Catsylvania, Tom is carried off to Dr. Frankensteins castle lab. Several lightning bolts later, a monster comes to life: a nine-foot-tall hulk with Toms relatively tiny head sewn on. Frankenstein orders the monster to go terrorize the village, but it has problems focusing after Toms head sees Jerry in the lab.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry go to a pool party at Toodles house and compete against Meathead and Butch in various pool games.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry investigate why Spike keeps getting mistaken for another dog.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

Tom wants to buy the tonic but soon finds out whats happening with the visiting cat and tries to get rid of him.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Pursuing Lamput is a dastardly career, but theres a right and a wrong way to go about it. Doc Specs cuts corners, showing up at the Lab with a fake Lamput made out of a jar of marmalade and a couple ping pong balls - a Jamposter! Specs relishes his new role as hero of the day, but his best friend Skinny smells a rat. As does Lamput, who is patently NOT captured. Not to mention a battalion of ants who dont care at all about Specs professional fortunes. Specs plan has a serious use-by date. Lucky Skinny can forgive. As a friend, hes the real deal.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: To escape the clutches of his dastardly pursuers, Lamput leaps onto Skinnys head and poses as a luscious mane of auburn hair. Shouldnt work. Works. Too well; Specs falls head over heels for this new redhead. Skinnys a bit puzzled as to why his bespectacled buddy is acting so weird all of a sudden. The course of true love never runs smooth; nor does the course of a moronic mixup between two annoying nerds. A wigless Skinny "crashes" Specs big fancy date (which, you know, Skinny was invited to) and Specs is very rude indeed about it. Now theyve both got broken hearts. Luckily ice-cream fixes everything.

programme.desc: Pursuing Lamput is a dastardly career, but theres a right and a wrong way to go about it. Doc Specs cuts corners, showing up at the Lab with a fake Lamput made out of a jar of marmalade and a couple ping pong balls - a Jamposter! Specs relishes his new role as hero of the day, but his best friend Skinny smells a rat. As does Lamput, who is patently NOT captured. Not to mention a battalion of ants who dont care at all about Specs professional fortunes. Specs plan has a serious use-by date. Lucky Skinny can forgive. As a friend, hes the real deal.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: To escape the clutches of his dastardly pursuers, Lamput leaps onto Skinnys head and poses as a luscious mane of auburn hair. Shouldnt work. Works. Too well; Specs falls head over heels for this new redhead. Skinnys a bit puzzled as to why his bespectacled buddy is acting so weird all of a sudden. The course of true love never runs smooth; nor does the course of a moronic mixup between two annoying nerds. A wigless Skinny "crashes" Specs big fancy date (which, you know, Skinny was invited to) and Specs is very rude indeed about it. Now theyve both got broken hearts. Luckily ice-cream fixes everything.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: Krypto embarks on a high-flying chase that creates major mayhem for a bus driver on his way to school.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Even for a giant seven foot bear, its not easy getting rid of pesky lemmings but its all fun seeing them constantly try to outsmart each other with cheeky plans

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Exasperated by the Lemmings who prevent him from watching his favorite TV show in peace Grizzy catapults them out of the cabin.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings dont agree about how often the cabins new cuckoo clock should play its song.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Woken with a start by a nightmare filled with Lemmings, Grizzy stumbles on the Rangers dream machine. Its a headphone set where you can program the theme of your choice before falling asleep within seconds for a night filled with sweet dreams. But who could possibly sleep soundly surrounded by Lemmings who want their fair share too?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy happens onto an old American India medallion bearing the symbol of the wind. He who wears it has the power to command air streams. Grizzy would be quite content to never leave the sofa again and control things from a distance, but the Lemmings want it to create fantastic new games that literally blow you away.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic Amerindian top modifies the mental age of anyone who watches it spin. From now on Grizzy has the mind of a 10-month old baby.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom gets a can of Cat Cop- a spray that creates a tiny cop that chases Jerry around.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry and Tuffy discover Gingers surprise for Rick in the garage: a brand-new air hockey table. They enjoy floating in zero gravity before Tom comes in and stops the fun. Soon, Butch challenges Tom to a game, until they start chasing Tuffy into the house and out back.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerry break a picture frame on the wall, Rick gives Tom an ultimatum that hes out for good if he breaks one more thing. Despite Toms earnest response, he breaks something right after Rick leaves to purchase a new frame. Attempting to fix the problem, Tom borrows tools and coveralls from a repair truck nearby but cant stop breaking things in the repair process.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Jerry overhears that a brand-new butler will arrive at the household later that day, the crafty mouse whips together a butlers outfit and knocks on the door, pretending to be the new arrival—to get unbridled access to the pantry. How long will Jerrys disguise work, and what happens when the real butler arrives?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom goes through reverse evolution and is transformed into a swamp monster, he uses it to his advantage, scaring creatures that frightened him earlier. Soon he sees Van Mouseling in the woods and cant resist chasing him all over.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Kept awake by Tom watching TV, Jerry goes outside and encounters some lightning bugs. The smallest one cant keep up, so Jerry steals Toms energy drink for the little guy. It helps, but soon the super-charged bug causes unexpected issues for Tom and Jerry.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: At a funfair, Mr Bean wins a balloon for Teddy and ties it to him while he plays on the hook a duck. But he’s so engrossed he doesn’t notice his companion floating away! Soon Mr Bean is chasing Teddy as he glides and snags on various fairground rides. Will Mr Bean rescue Teddy before he floats away forever?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is keen to own a brand new smart phone when he discovers all the wonderful things it can do. But after a trip to the mobile phone shop he is horrified at how much they cost and decides to build his own one. Bean’s phone may be bulky but it comes with a whole range of built in gadgets especially useful during a race to The Tower of London.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A clueless yet clever loner bungles his way through life in London. Mr Bean has some unexpected guests who think he runs a hotel!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: While Mr. Bean is taking photos of wildlife, he sees big footprints belonging to a dinosaur. He starts running away but then gets an idea to take a photo of these footprints, hoping hell become famous. However, the dinosaur turns out to be part of a set for a movie called Jurassic Hero and Bean is added to the cast.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Beans landlady orders him to get rid of a mole making a mess of her exquisitely manicured croquet lawn.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is angry about roadworks.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidently causes Mrs Wicket to be hospitalised and in need of a wheelchair. Back home Mr Bean has thoughtfully set up a bell service so that he can be at Mrs Wicket’s beck and call at any time of day or night. Mrs Wicket likes this...a lot. The bell doesn’t stop ringing and an exhausted Mr Bean finds himself running up and down the stairs carrying and fetching until he eventually loses patience with his patient.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean ends up on stage at the opera house...in a dress!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When one of the toy cars of his racing track set becomes broken, Mr. Bean decides to buy a new one but since his Mini has a flat tire, he decides to take a taxi. The taxi driver deliberately drives around the town and stops for gas and lunch in the hopes of getting a higher fare. Bean tries to escape, but other passengers mistake Bean as the driver, and Bean reluctantly drives the taxi.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Everyone seems to be going on holiday apart from Mr Bean, so he decides to recreate one at home!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Catastrophe strikes!! The Boss has a shaving accident that costs him his glorious Tache! It really stirs up some deep seated family issues for him.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs come up with a new gadget, giving them the ability to take on the animal’s strength to take Lamput down!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput and Specs find themselves on an island. Spec learns a harsh lesson on listening.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Mayor Leghorn to build the venue for the Looney Games. They soon become overwhelmed by the job and must ask for help.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: When a black cat crosses Krypto’s path, he’s determined to catch it before Halloween night is through.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: When a black cat crosses Krypto’s path, he’s determined to catch it before Halloween night is through.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Buff makes a wish on a magic artifact for the other Batwheels to be turned into monster trucks, just like him! The rest of the Batwheels must learn how to use their big new bodies to undo the wish!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi just can’t put down her new exciting video game, even when MOE needs her help packing Bam’s utility belt for a mission. / Buff tries to show Batwing how great it is to volunteer to help Gothams needy, but the Legion of Zoom get in the way.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The Gang climb aboard the cruise ship run by Freds cousin, despite Velmas strong dislike of water, and terrifying Sea Monsters!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: To solve the mystery of a ghostly performer haunting her former venue the Gang has to pretend to be a rock band themselves!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket has just inherited an antique grandfather clock – Mr Bean is impressed! But he soon starts to resent it when it bongs loudly on the hour all through the night. Desperate for sleep as dawn is breaking, he fiddles inside the clock, only for it to fall apart and onto the floor! Can he get the bulky heirloom to a repair shop and back before Mrs Wicket wakes up?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean crashes his mini into a pool of slurry and is desperate to get himself and his car clean.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Its Irmas birthday. Bean writes out two cards - one nice, one silly. He gets his envelopes mixed up and sends off the wrong card.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean breaks his bed using it as a trampoline. He tries to fix it, but he cant. Next morning, he goes to buy a brand-new bed.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean drives her and Miss Wince to their booked spa retreat; and wait outside in the car until they’re done.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean is both cajoled by Irma and spurred by his own jealousy of the fund-raising super-star Declan into raising money for the local donkey sanctuary.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Great Eduardo, violinist supreme, is in town and Irma wants to go to the concert. But Bean wont pay for the tickets

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Everyone seems to be going on holiday apart from Mr Bean, so he decides to recreate one at home!

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids are getting to know Kaboom City when they get their first mission: to save Super C from Jack the Juicer.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang tours an old Hollywood Studio, but they soon uncover a mystery concerning the ghost of a silent film comedy star who has returned to make sure his recently discovered final film is never seen!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gangs adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and Skinny celebrate a brand new arrival to the family: a body lotion that delivers incredible speed to its wearer. Yay Science! The boys quickly include the speed lotion in their morning routine, because testing inventions on yourself is always a good idea. Then its time to get out there and nab Lamput once and for all. Results are mixed. On the one hand, the "zoom oil" certainly works. On the other hand, these nerds arent really used to having a body that can actually do things. Conclusion: the docs still fail, only this time they fail really quickly. At least they get that round the world trip they were dreaming of.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket has just inherited an antique grandfather clock – Mr Bean is impressed! But he soon starts to resent it when it bongs loudly on the hour all through the night. Desperate for sleep as dawn is breaking, he fiddles inside the clock, only for it to fall apart and onto the floor! Can he get the bulky heirloom to a repair shop and back before Mrs Wicket wakes up?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean inadvertently becomes a teacher. Can he control the unruly class?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean finds out he is a Lord and visits his Scottish family home. But keeping a castle is a costly business.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean arranges a last-minute birthday treat for Teddy, including a morning in a toy shop and burgers for lunch. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: To trick Grizzys vigilance and steal the TV, the Lemmings, disguised as traditional Chinese dancers, perform a number that leaves the bear flabbergasted. The rodents take advantage of their diversion to carry off the TV set on their airborne craft made of Chinese umbrellas. But before they can escape with their bounty, Grizzy recovers the screen. Ever as determined, the Lemmings come back after upgrading their vessel.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Annoyed by a noisy high-speed chase between the Lemmings and a raccoon, Grizzy abruptly stops the game. The players fall into empty space and land in a clearing.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: On the way back from a fishing outing, Grizzy unwittingly brings back an electrode that controls a robot. Once activated, the gadget puts itself in the service of the bear, satisfying his each and every need. The envious Lemmings plot to take possession of this new metallic ally. They manage to evict the bear, who does not intend to take this lying down… especially when he discovers a pair of robotic arms hidden in a module that fell out of the robot!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: At nightfall, just as Grizzy starts to doze off, a racket comes from outside the cabin: the Lemmings are sliding along the Great Wall in a crate, propelled by firework rockets. Cleverly avoiding the bears strategies to stop them, the Lemmings accidentally set off a mechanism in a tower. A secret room filled with cannons and catapults opens, just waiting to be used by the powder monkey apprentices…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the last jar of Yummy chocolate spread in the cabin and it ends up sinking in the lagoon. The bear makes a diving suit from various home facilities, while the Lemmings share a diving tank to put a wrench in their adversarys flippers! But the local wildlife comes to meet them.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy invents a delicious drink made with chocolate and coconut milk. The Lemmings want to sip on this sweet treat, too!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings need something fast to tow their parasailing kite — maybe something like the big fish Grizzy just caught?

programme.title: Moley: Squirm And Manny
programme.desc: Squirm asks Manny to magic up an ice cream to help him cool down in the hot sun. But Squirm’s eyes are bigger than his belly…or are they??

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam must lead a new super vehicle team consisting of Nightbike, Goldie, Grundy, and Kitty after the Legion of Zoom traps the rest of the Batwheels in the Batcave.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird is convinced that nobody likes his eccentric dance moves, but its up to the rambunctious rally car to dance his way to victory.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After Nightbike reveals that hes afraid of loud noises, the Batwheels help him overcome his fear so he can stop The Penguin from stealing some valuable cargo.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Feeling insecure about his size after a game of Hide-And-Seek, Buff uses the shrink belt belonging to The Atom and accidentally shrinks himself down to the size of a mouse!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Mac and Tosh Gopher hire the Looney Builders to build an underground home. Daffy is unable to remove rocks from the area fast enough.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Bizzy Buzzards mom hires the builders to build a nest.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Hoots Talon to expand and paint the old library.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by the Mouse Sisters to build a bridge over a mac and cheese spill.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When the pets believe that they are going to run out of food during a snowstorm, they start hoarding food. Things get out of control when they start stealing food and double crossing each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry and Napoleon play around with Bigbys brand-new anti-gravity machine ... until Tom breaks into the lab and a chase begins. The machine wrecks havoc on the entire lab, including the cafeteria.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When the witches leave on vacation, Toms dreams of rest and relaxation are ruined when their nephew Grayson comes over and throws a giant ghost party. When he steals the witches crystal ball, Tom and Jerry must travel into the afterlife to get it back.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Bigby invents an asteroid buster, which Jerry uses for fun. Tom accidentally gives himself electrical superpowers after causing a power outage, and now Jerry must fend off Tom while fighting off an asteroid heading right toward their lab. Plus, Napoleon is stuck in a vending machine during the power outage.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitch’s arm shorts out, Ella’s dad has the right tools to fix him. While he’s at it, Dad shows off his latest creation, a Super Towing Arm. Slippy is impressed, and Glitch is more than happy to try it on for size!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is enlisted to pet sit Buttons, a friend’s dog, on the very day she has to finish a school project about Venus. She decides to take on both responsibilities at once by taking Buttons with her to the planet to capture the final piece of video footage she needs. When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. It’s Buttons who finds Ella! Ella admits she shouldn’t have taken her furry friend with her, but at least she learned new facts for her project!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy’s Dad insists he get rid of all his inventions to free up some space. Slippy can’t bear to, so decides to store them on the dark side of Mercury.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: On Sedna, Ella and her friends discover the space probe Voyager 1. Ella takes the Golden Record from the probe and takes it to Mom who reveals that Ella’s greatest grandfather recorded a greeting on it!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Human Day is Ella’s favourite day of the year and she invites Madhu to join her family for dinner. Madhu wants to make a good impression and wonders how to prepare. With Maggie’s help, Madhu learns about the customs of different cultures.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad volunteers to babysit Portly for the Otters only to find babysitting isn’t as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge normally hibernates but this year she is determined to see Christmas. Although she’s not much use in decoration preparation, she is able to bring peace and understanding to all when there is a dispute over the Christmas Tree.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Tinker comes up with a cunning plan for herself and Chief to be delivered as a parcel into Toad Hall. But the journey there proves to be more much more arduous than she could possibly imagine.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Chief agrees to accompany Toad on a day trip, but only if he can drive. Chiefs plan is to steal the car by throwing Toad out, but his erratic driving sees them perched precariously over the riverbank. Can they ever be friends now?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Hedge learns to play chess, she fails to win gracefully. Soon no-one will play with her!

programme.title: Mike Brewer: Born Dealer
programme.desc: Mike heads to Poland to avoid the dreaded British Porsche Tax. Plus, he turns a profit on an ugly duckling Peugeot and chases a sale at Santa Pod.

programme.title: Twin Turbos
programme.desc: The Debertis build an epic Rockcrawler. Plus, Brads first asphalt race leads to a valuable lesson when hes involved in a high-speed crash.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Carpenter Steve tries to save a woodworm-infested Georgian settle. Meanwhile, sculptor Nick is faced with his most unusual project yet - a fairground Dodgem car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer settles for a Volkswagen T2 panel van after his budget proves too tight for a classic Camper, and mechanic Edd China agrees to ambitious plans concerning its renovation.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Find out how mosquito coils, solar-assist tricycles, palm oil, and fiberglass chopper guns are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Get behind the wheel of the worlds biggest land vehicles as they mine 90,000 tons of coal a day, and hunt for alligators in the Florida swamps.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew is in Scotland to see a Victorian theatre in Aberdeen and the remote town of Rothes. Tee shows him how to do a deal at a steam railway in Devon.

programme.title: Scrappers
programme.desc: Marek and Edek get a job to remove railway tracks from the Museum near Modlin Fortress. However, a faulty grinder and torrential rain dont help. Will they manage to overcome the difficulties?

programme.title: Van Go
programme.desc: Brett builds a mobile bike shop for two friends and their non-profit. He creates the space to transport and repair all the bikes before their West Coast adventure.

programme.title: Van Go
programme.desc: Brett builds a peaceful retreat on wheels to honour a clients late mum. One of his most elaborate builds, it includes a bedroom, bath and kitchen.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to search for a rare Fiat Dino Coupe, but the car he finds needs extensive work by expert mechanic Edd China before it can be sold.

programme.title: Gold Rush: Mine Rescue with Freddy And Juan
programme.desc: In California, Freddy and Juan rescue their first-ever hard rock operation. As stakes heat up with big fixes, Freddy makes a million-dollar discovery.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Isaac from the Opal Whisperers works an abandoned, dangerous mine. The Mooka Boys are confronted by an irate miner as they peg a claim too close to his mine.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: Dropped onto an Alaskan glacier, all-star survivalists Laura and Steven stave off frostbite and hypothermia. Their skills and survivor instinct are tested.

programme.title: Ant Anstead: Born Mechanic
programme.desc: Ant finds a 1977 MG Midget 1500, just like the first car he restored as a teen. With tight margins and a rust issue, he pulls in his family to help.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they take the worlds sharpest photos, stitch an airbag to catch a falling car, and produce billions of perfectly-formed jelly beans?

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: How do they make hot air balloons, miniature silverware, transmissions, and darts? Find out, as more items are put under the microscope.

programme.title: Fast N Loud
programme.desc: As the Monkeys race to finish their first big build without Aaron, Richard tries to unload his 65 Shelby Mustang GT with a frozen engine.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Water in his fuel causes Jake to have a psychotic episode. Keith fires a dishonest deckhand, ending in a final confrontation at the airport bar.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys enter the shadow of Mount Denali. Marty, Misty and Matt address food, water, and shelter concerns so that both homesteads may survive winter.

programme.title: Moonshiners: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: When a first-time distillery owner invests $2 million in a pot still and hires rookies to run it, moonshiner Tim Smith comes to the rescue!

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The force is strong with paper conservator Ashleigh as she restores an original Star Wars poster. And upholsterer Ray updates a pair of 1960s designer chairs.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: Land speed record holder Jessi Combs and Moonshiner Josh Owens put their motor-head knowledge to the test as they compete for the mystery prize.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: Moonshiner Josh Owens and metal fabricator James Pumphrey face off as they aim to predict the outcome of the worlds most insane motor videos.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys enter the shadow of Mount Denali. Marty, Misty and Matt address food, water, and shelter concerns so that both homesteads may survive winter.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer lands a Ford Escort Mk1 for £4,500 in an internet auction, and he and Edd China get to work on giving the classic 1970s car a new lease of life with a retro refit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew and Paul spot a classic Golf GTI at a film props company. And, at a barn in Suffolk Drew unearths an early 1970s Lotus Elan which needs radical restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: It sounds like the ultimate 90s supercar bargain and Mike couldnt be more pleased with his V8, but when he sees the state of it, Edd doesnt feel as enthusiastic.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Find out how wood toys, retro toasters, laboratory furnaces, and aerogels are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of steam turbines and racing cars. Plus, how black boxes are built to survive plane crashes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew snaps up an unusual Victorian oil lamp with a wild appearance, uncovers a stunning design from Americas past, and meets one of the worlds most impressive salvagers, whose private collection boasts its own steam train.

programme.title: Scrappers
programme.desc: The scrappers from Pruszkow set off for a job at the Warsaw ZOO. A low fence needs to be cut. The easy task is complicated by the lack of suitable tools. How will the gentlemen cope?

programme.title: Farmhouse Fixer
programme.desc: Jon Knight and Kristina Crestin are given a budget of $280,000 to overhaul an old family home. They plan to create a modern home full of sentimental touches.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike is seduced by a stunning Morgan Plus 4 at only £13,000, but it needs a new chassis and fitting it will take at least a hundred man hours. How will Edd react?

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Dave has a soft spot for all kids in need. So, when a car show in Oregon that benefits the local childrens charity called, Dave eagerly said yes.

programme.title: Twin Turbos
programme.desc: The Debertis convert an F-150 into an off-road beast for NASCARs Joey Logano. In exchange, Joey teaches Brad how to drive on asphalt, which means that truck build has to be perfect.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy deVilles team sees potential in a 1980s MG sports car with an ugly rubber bumper. Using the elegant stripped-back speedster look, a radical new shape is created.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: In the Honduran rainforest, a survivalist and a hard-headed detective try to thrive for 21 days. But, jaguars, fire ants and a debilitating injury may stop them.

programme.title: Ant Anstead: Born Mechanic
programme.desc: A 1964 T-Bird needs pricey American parts to restore it to its former glory. And Ant gets a hand from his mate, Mike Brewer.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they build a caravan, forge tuning forks, resurface an ice rink, and put on the worlds biggest light festival?

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how they are made, including magnets, cooked ham, silver-plated teapots and crash test dummies.

programme.title: Fast N Loud
programme.desc: Richard brings in Gas Monkeys first ever guest builder as Dallas hot-rodder Brian Bass teams up with the Monkeys to build a 60s style hot rod out of a 34 Ford Coupe.

programme.title: Road Rage
programme.desc: A woman bites another driver. A young woman takes evasive manoeuvres to survive a road-raging driver. Motorists fight in a drive-thru.

programme.title: Road Rage
programme.desc: Good Samaritans rescue road rage victims. Californians negotiate dangerous roadways. A man defends his child from a gun-toting menace.

programme.title: Border Control Italia
programme.desc: Follows the officers of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Italy, which are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Body Cam
programme.desc: In Georgia, a county commissioner fires at police officers in a retirement village. In Florida, officers search for a fugitive suspected of carrying a machete.

programme.title: Moonshiners: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: The Williams family made Carolina whiskey for generations. When Tim recreates the old recipe, he finds one of the most important distilleries in US history.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Painter Gill brings the romance back to a faded Chinese marriage cabinet. And leather specialist Martin saves a rare suitcase thats one of the best hes seen.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: Record breaking racer and off-road champion Jessi Combs faces off against celebrity bike customiser Jesse James in a battle of motor wits.

programme.title: Brake Room

programme.title: Botched: Post Op
programme.desc: The first of a short series of after-show specials that takes an in-depth look at highlighted cases from the hit medical show Botched. Host Heather Dubrow, alongside renowned plastic surgery experts Terry Dubrow and Paul Nassif, recaps a selected Botched episode. Viewers can learn more about the patients at the heart of the show, with never before seen footage and newly-revealed secrets. The hosts are joined by the relevant patients and some surprise celebrity guests in this light-hearted and sometimes comedic look back at the life-changing cases that the doctors were tasked with. Get the inside scoop from the doctors themselves as they discuss the decisions they had to make when managing the needs of the patients in their care. Then learn from the patients themselves as they showcase their newly-restored bodies and give insights into how the doctors have changed their lives for the better.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: In the wake of increased reports of Bigfoot sightings from across the United States, scientific methods are used to examine whether witnesses are seeing a known animal or the same creature described throughout history.

programme.title: Lost Worlds

programme.desc: Find out how realistic the space metropolises imagined in science fiction may be.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans

programme.desc: A million bats with tiny bombs strapped to their chests, inflatable tanks, robot assassins, bazooka Vespas, and war dolphins. These weapons, and others, pushed the boundaries of possible in the weirdest ways ever.

programme.desc: Every major civilisation believed in curses, and their power to inflict harm on the unsuspecting. People are still afraid of walking into a cursed place or touching a reportedly-cursed object. If curses are real, what brings them into existence?

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy has just finished eating all the hiking-sock-flavoured jam, and he doesn’t know what to do with all the jars, so he goes to Okido to ask! When Messy lands, Felix and Zoe are playing some new instruments that they made them themselves! Suddenly, Zoe realises she has lost her communicator. Zoe thinks it must be in the Cloudship, so they hail the Okidoodle to take them there. Zam is putting out the rubbish when they arrive, and Zim has just finished cleaning the entire kitchen! Clearly it’s not where Zoe left it, so they check the bins in case it was thrown away by accident. But the rubbish has already been taken when they get there!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry invites Huck to return to Berry Bitty City to co-write a story with her to submit to an online mystery magazine. He is hopeful that if the story is accepted, he can raise funds for his new Huck’s Hotel for Homeless Pets. But as they write the story, Huck feels he isn’t contributing anything—Blueberry’s insistence on duplicating the style of Patti Persimmon dominates their story. Trouble ensues when Blueberry learns Huck is writing a song with Cherry. She thinks he has found a new writing partner he likes better than her.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Charlie is having a sleepover and has invited Harry, however, Charlies Mum says he is only allowed to bring one of the dinos with him.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry goes to Dino-World to learn how to make origami animals.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Join the Junior Rangers as they race across the tundra to reunite a lost reindeer calf with its herd. However, a river crossing might prove too tiring for the young reindeer.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Philip shows off to James about how many trucks he can pull, James decides to prove that he is the stronger engine by pulling a very long train. Soon disaster strikes as James can’t control all of the trucks and comes off the rails breaking through the side of a stone bridge. Philip races to save James and the brave little engine slips under James to rescue his new friend from falling and props him up until help arrives.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sidney is a very hard working diesel, but he’s also very forgetful. One day The Fat Controller gives him a very special job – Sidney needs to go to Brendam Docks to collect Percy’s new wheels. But when Sidney admits that he’s worried he might forget what he has to do, Thomas suggests making up a little song to help him remember. Sidney goes off happily singing a song about collecting a crate from Brendam docks, but when he stops to talk to Gordon he gets distracted, forgets what he’s supposed to be doing, and ends up at The Waste Dump looking for boilers then The Animal Park waiting for an elephant!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has a new mission: helping Toramento to change the lighthouse’s bulb. Soon he discovers that this is not the only problem with the lighthouse. The rotating lamp is also blocked by a seagulls nest. And the seagull doesnt allow anyone to approach its nest. Grisu, being attacked by the animal, spits a flame and burns the bulb. How to replace it? He must find a solution quickly before a boat runs aground on the reefs. Could Fume do the trick? Grisù asks his father for help. Thanks to Stella and Toramento, Fume will overcome his hate of water, thus being able to reach Grisu. Then, he will replace the light bulb by spitting out the biggest flame ever.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza wants to study hawklings about to hatch on top of Mount Dragonberg and for that, she needs to set up a camera in their nest. Grisu accompanies her – as a fellow mountain climber. But hes not quite a seasoned one and has a few comic failures (fortunately he has a safety rope). As they are about to cross a wooden bridge, Fume – whos tagging along – accidently wakes up a grumpy bear. Surprised, Grisu breathes out a flame that burns the bridge, ruining the expedition. But a firefighter never gives up.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse finds a sparkly rock and announces that it’s treasure. Little Nutbrown Hare wants a sparkly treasure too, so they set about finding him one that night, by the silvery light of the full moon. Together, they discover that treasure is found in the most unexpected places. When a very ordinary looking rock cracks open to reveal sparkly crystals inside, Little Nutbrown Hare realises that things are not always what they seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants to show Big Nutbrown Hare something special too, something he has never seen before. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Berry is annoyed with Edmund as he does not want to play at skittles with her. She decides to change fathers. Accompanied by Rosie, she wants to find out what her friends’ fathers are like.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are building a special area to celebrate local citizens who have improved the life of Spring City. Each recipient will get to see his or her image inside a golden star on a plinth. But Mayor Madison is struggling to decide who exactly will feature in the very first golden star. Various suggestions include Mr. Bentley, who is very keen to be chosen, Tilly and Jenny. But when the Spring City Rockets suggest Betsy, Scoop decides that the honour should go to a machine – and that machine should be him. Scoop shows off in front of Maria hoping he will be chosen. But his reckless behavior results in cutting through an electric cable and causing a massive power cut.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scoop is fascinated by a heavy storm, but the impressive lightning damages the Fixham Lighthouse. Bob and the team must repair its lamp and replace its main power cable before dark. On the way they pass Curtis at the Marina and learn that the storm also damaged his motor boat, which hes trying to fix. While Lofty helps remove and replace the lamp, Scoop digs up the old power cable from the lighthouse to shore. With the tide coming in and night-time approaching, Bob and Wendy stay at the lighthouse to finish the job. They get the lamp working again, just as a new lightning storm arrives. Fascinated by the lightning, Scoop accidentally pulls out the new cable and cuts the power.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: All the balls at Farmer Patrick Pigs new mini putt are disappearing. After much investigation Huckle and the gang track the missing balls to Patricks record breaking ‘egg laying’ chicken. / When the gold coins Mr Fix It finds on the beach disappear, Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to find out where they went.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero travel to Peru to take a marvellous spatuletail home. But what can they do when the hungry bird falls into a deep sleep?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a wild boar in their garden back to the forest. There, Ranger Rocky advises the Junior Rangers to find the boar’s sounder, which is a group of female wild boars and their young children.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon has invited Lou, Mamadou and Ferdinand over to play in his back yard. Ferdinand is bugging everyone by waving little insects under their noses and scaring them. Simon, Mamadou and Lou have had quite enough and decide to ditch Ferdinand by hiding in the attic. He’ll never find them there! But when the three friends see a big spider their screaming gives them away and Ferdinand finds them. Except when he reaches the attic, who should Ferdinand come nose to nose with but…the spider! Ahhhh! How’s that for a taste of his own medicine?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly stands trembling at Tildas door: last night she heard noises in the village shop and then found an empty tin can. Its bound to have been a hungry ghost making trouble! That night, Tilda, Rupert, Molly and Edna lie in wait in the village shop to catch the ghost red-handed.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A tiring gardening session make the friends of Wild Rose Lane dream of going away on holiday. But none of them wants to be all alone in far-off places. So Tilda suggests that they simply swap homes. No sooner said than done! Tilda moves in to Ednas, Molly to Ruperts, Robin to Tildas, the squirrels to Mollys and Rupert to Robins.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: While Tilda is having a picnic by the river with her friends, Snaily creeps into the garden to look for food. He sees another snail that has fallen asleep on the wall of the house and is threatening to dry out. Courageously, Snaily saves the other snail, but in doing so gets trapped under a bucket.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Chilly Autumn winds blow as Little Nutbrown Hare chases the beautiful fallen leaves. When one wafts so high that only a bird could catch it Little Nutbrown Hare wishes he could fly as well. He and Little Field Mouse try every way they can think of to fly, without luck. They have fun trying, however, and along the way they discover they have their own very special talents.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must go all day without speaking – but there’s a little room for error, as they’re each given three ‘lives.’ Wilson loses one of his lives when he shouts out during a Safari Park tour, chasing away the animals and spoiling the tour. He learns that by concentrating and breathing deeply he can control his need to make noise. Not only does he earn his badge, he gets the extra reward of seeing loads of wonderful animals that only come out when it’s quiet!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai testing his new Kaizer upgrade, which detects sounds from afar. He picks up the sound of gushing water and a snow leopards yowl, leading him to investigate further. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a rescue mission game, communicate through their communication devices and pretend to find clues related to a lost hiker. They discover tracks and eventually locate the lost hiker, who is represented by a stuffed toy. They realize they need transportation to rescue the hiker and use Hero, the dog, as their "rescue transportation." The game was cut short as Leo receives a call from Kai on the animal he discover, which was revealed to be a snow leopard and is in trouble. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and meet up with Kai at his location. The Junior Rangers arrive in the mountains of Nepal. Kai struggles to pinpoint the exact location of the Snow Leopard due to the echo caused by the mountains. Hero uses his sense of smell and finds faint Snow Leopard paw prints, leading the group in the right direction. While following the paw prints, they encounter difficulties due to fresh snow covering the tracks. Leo uses binoculars to search for the well-camouflaged Snow Leopard.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is collecting plant specimens at the nature reserves when suddenly she sees an interesting fallen plant nearby and examines it. Then, she sees a pregnant walking catfish squirming about on the path. Weirded out by a fish on land, she calls in the Junior Rangers for some assistance. At the garden, Leo And Katie are playing animal charades. Katie manages to guess Leos chimpanzee performance but Leo cant figure out her Moths performance. Their game is interrupted by Zari, asking their thoughts on the struggling fish. The Junior Rangers get to the treehouse and learn more about the animal in the picture, revealing it as a Walking Catfish. Katie warns Zari not touch it as the fish may sting her with the spike on its spine. Another catfish appears and moves fast, causing Zari to worried if the catfish could be injured. She asks the Junior Ranger to help and the Ranger agree before hoping into PlatypusOne. As they arrive to the scene, the Junior Ranger ask Zari. on the fishs status and Zari replied not that great. They then decide to help the animal get to the nearest body of water and think on how to get the fish into the bucket without getting close to it. While Zari go fill up the bucket with water, Leo grabs the fish with his Backpack Grabber. Zari returns with bucket of water but Leo is having difficulties of grabbing the slippery fish. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky emerge from a bush, surprising the Junior Rangers. He tells them that he was revealing to study tadpoles nearby before meeting them.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is "picnic in the forest day!" And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her "shameful secret…"

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today is Charley’s birthday! And not only Charley’s but also Louis’! A baking workshop is on the agenda for today because there is not one but two cakes that need to be prepared, by two teams, supervised by two willing and motivated adults who will show the class that baking is not all child’s play…!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Noises on the roof prevented Julia from sleeping last night. Those noises were made by Miss Astro that observe the night sky. Julia get nostalgic of the sky she could admire on her island...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia has caught mousie pox. Doctor Spotty is sorry but she is not allowed to see Sam anymore for a few days, and get bored alone in her room. How can she play with her friend without disobey?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has agreed to water Mr. Grumpys flowers. When they enters Mr. Grumpys empty apartment, Sam and Julia discover that Mr. Grumpy has some hidden reasons for being so withdrawn...

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas thinks that Raul the Brazilian tank engine is fun because he turns every boring task into a game.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When some of the engines think life would be easier without Diesel, he decides to teach them a lesson by hiding. But his plan backfires when none of the engines come looking for him! Diesel is painted with glow-in-the-dark paint and he plays a trick on the other engines... but Nia and Paxton surprise him in return!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends learn about Vikings at school, and then have a Viking imagination adventure at break time.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wakes up with an itchy rash. Hes supposed to go and see grandma today, but doesnt want to make her sick, so needs to figure out where it came from.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is lying on the ground with orange floating devices. When Parrot asks what he is up to, Monkey explains that he is practicing for the world Floating championship but when he does it in the water he always sinks. Mole appears and tells them about Alligators impressing floating abilities and they decide to go to the lake and pay him a visit.eir natural habitats through engaging song and dance.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The grand unveiling of the new community library is in danger when Mandy realizes there aren’t enough books for everyone! She sends Norman and James to get more books, but is in such a rush that she encourages them to take a dangerous shortcut…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Pontypandy Pioneers are tasked with making a simple cup of tea to earn a badge and a new Pioneer Vest, but Peter and Mandy misinterpret the instructions and, in their attempt to make a cup of tea from scratch, accidentally start a forest fire!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Mr. Turtle and Mr. Fox build a mini-putt course for Franklin and Fox, Franklin becomes so intent on performing well and winning that he ends up having a terrible time. Its only when he sees the two dads goofing around on the course and having a ball no matter what the score, that he realizes the game is meant to be fun above all. / Franklin gives Fox an old broken radio from his giveaway pile. But when Fox fixes it up and plays cool music for their delighted friends, Franklin suddenly decides he wants the radio back for himself. But when taking it back only ends up making him feel crummy, Franklin realizes that when you give something away, you have to let go.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: It’s Mother’s Day when all the mothers get together to talk about their daily lives and the community. Meanwhile, the fathers and children prepare them a pleasant evening along with some surprises. Rosie has decided to mark the occasion with a lovely sculpture for her mother but things do not turn out quite as expected.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: On one of Sketckys holiday photos, Doodleboo and Sketcky discover an egg in a nest. But the nest is not in a tree. Doodleboo will show Sketcky what this strange animal is, that lays eggs and does not fly.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: While Doodleboo and Sketcky sunbathe, Sketcky wants to know more about the sky, clouds, and space! Doodleboo has the idea of a Riddleboo that will reveal all the secrets of the universe to Sketcky...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to succeed in doing his magic tricks, but he fails them all the time. Doodleboo is no more talented than he, but he has a magic Riddleboo for his friend to discover!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: A sad Ruff-Ruff learns how to be a happy puppy again, on his very own adventure. His friends are sure a new favourite stick, to replace his broken one, will make him happy, so they all set off to find one. By having fun and playing together on his adventure, Ruff-Ruff is soon ‘Ruff-Ruff-ier’ than ever, barking happily, wagging his tail and showing them all why dogs make such great friends!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make up a special song to sing at Speedy Sheep’s birthday party. Hatty helps them choose a great tune, find words and moves to make their song really personal to Speedy and everyone joins in the celebrations, laa’ing and baa’ing!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a windy day and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop. And he wants to do it all by himself. Even when Pando arrives and wants to help Bing insists on doing it his way. When the kite gets caught up in the park bench Bing realises that there are some times when another pair of hands comes in handy.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s bath time and Bing just can’t help adding a few more quirts of bubble goo…and a few more….and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkeys enormous pile of coconuts falls into parrot’s hammock and rips it. Monkey looks for a needle to fix it. Mole suggests going to Hedgehog, whose back is covered with prickly needle like spines. They fly off to the forest and meet the shy hedgehog who gives them a needle and plays a game of Monkey See Monkey Do with them.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah and Mandy film a piece for the Scoop Dooley Show, and Scoop Dooley tries to make everything more sensational.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a mission to rescue Luc the wild boar, Moose ends up needing a rescue himself - and the multi - vehicle rescue gives Ellie a chance to show the Fire Cadets the importance of being slow and careful in a firefighter’s tasks.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper decides to make something out of old bits and pieces he finds lying around. He thinks hes making a flying machine, but in fact it turns out to be something much more useful for a hot day.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper Tiger and the others are having a picnic on Big Hill. Arnold’s so busy banging on his new drum he doesn’t even want a sandwich. Tiger goes to hunt bugs and get away from the noise. He gets stuck in the root of a tree but luckily he has taken a biscuit tin with him to put the bugs in and finds himself drumming too as he beats on it for the others to come and rescue him.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today, T’choupi and his friends, Nina and Luce, must help Fred take his goats to a field a certain distance away. But when Loupiote the dog gets wounded and is unable to shepherd the goats, the kids are very disappointed. Until, all of a sudden, they get a brilliant idea: why don’t they stand in for Loupiote and play shepherd dog, to guide the goat herd to the grazing field?...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi and Nina find out there’s going to be a star shower visible in the sky tonight, they get very excited, and determined not to miss it! But they’re going to have to persuade their parents in order for that to happen… Not an easy feat: they’re way too young to stay up so late…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma offers Sam and Julia a curious calendar representing the Mouse Mansion, each numbered window revealing an apartment the way it was long ago when its inhabitant first arrived.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The triplets are hard to put to sleep. Just as hard as Sams dad was! says Grandma. The only thing that used to put him to sleep was an old mobile, but its completely out of order...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda asks Edna to repair her entrance door that creaks so loudly that her guests want to leave Guesthouse Appleseed. But normally, Rupert does all repairing work for Tilda and interferes.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The wind is blowing on the beach while the Triplets are really excited at the thought of trying their brand new kite. But because of the wind "ziouuuff" the three sun hats fly away and go into the sea. The children don’t know what to do and look for a way to get their hats back. But by the way, where are going all the items which fly away?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The boys and Kiko are making a football field to play on the beach, all they need is a fourth player to make two teams. They ask Girl who was picking up shells on the beach. She happily accepts their offer but once the field’s ready, and with no explication at all, Girl starts sulking on her towel and refuse to talk to the boys. Nothing will make her stop, not pulling faces, not Mommies’ hugs, not even candies! What could have possibly happen?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy is suffering from not feeling appreciated enough by the forest children. It is always Scoutbadger who does extraordinary things and gets all the recognition. Woodsy is hurt and decides to pull off an exploit - to bring back the scarecrow’s hat and so be finally acclaimed a hero.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: At Clementines birthday party, Caillou and his friends, under the watchful eye of Clems moms do loads of fun beach activities to make Clems day special.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes swimming with Dolphins at the aquarium with his family.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Stephen is the oldest engine on the Island of Sodor and people love to see him, so sometimes he makes special journeys round the island. He’s still called the Rocket, though he’s much slower than the other engines. Sometimes they have to slow down for him, which Gordon in particular doesn’t like. But it’s because Stephen travels so slowly that he notices that the Suspension Bridge is damaged and manages to alert the other engines in time to avoid a disaster!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Fire chugger Asher is giving Wilson some advanced fire training.
